title.narrative: Food Security Program with Project AGAPE - Armenia - 2015

description.narrative: Project AGAPE, is a joint-ministry venture of the Western and North Carolina Conferences of the United Methodist Church. It is the only organized humanitarian group working in the Kashatagh region of the Nagorno-Karabagh Republic, which has the highest concentration of refugees of war and displaced people from the land dispute between Azerbaijan and Armenia. Project AGAPE supports affected communities holistically by providing for the basic needs of the people, building schools, hospitals, water and sanitation systems and supporting the families’ livelihoods. Meals from Stop Hunger Now serve more than 450 vulnerable children in kindergartens, children's homes and an after-school support center.
